meanings.definition: Relating to the study of drugs that affect the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The neuropharmacological research focused on how certain medications impact the brain.
meanings.sent2: Doctors conducted a neuropharmacological study to understand how drugs influence the nervous system.
meanings.sent3: The neuropharmacological investigation revealed some surprising findings about nerve-altering substances.
meanings.sent4: Her work in neuropharmacological research shed light on the intricate relationship between drugs and the nervous system.
meanings.sent5: The professor's neuropharmacological lecture made the complex topic easier to grasp.

meanings.definition: Involving the effects of drugs on the brain and nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The neuropharmacological impact of the medication was carefully analyzed by the scientists.
meanings.sent2: Researchers studied the neuropharmacological properties of the new drug.
meanings.sent3: The neuropharmacological side effects of the pill surprised the patients.
meanings.sent4: His neuropharmacological approach to treatment revolutionized the field of medicine.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained the neuropharmacological aspects of the drug in simple terms.
